Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2014 08:23PM - edited Sep 16, 2014 08:24PM by Kelscs Just logged on to this site, got back on a few weeks ago. Apparently I logged in to my old account I forgot I had. I feel bad I never told anyone the outcome! I had an excisional biopsy and it came back benign! Yay.... But here I am back four years later scared I have pagets of the nipple. Very insanely itchy, dry, flaky, peely, and now tingly nipple and areola. I have tried numerous rx steroid n non steroid creams n gels, even antifungal creams and pills. Only getting worse and no improvement. Ultrasound normal. MRI showed areola thickening likely related to skin abnormality and inflammation, but considered normal. Had a punch biopsy today...so again I WAIT :/
Posts.Title: Anxiously waiting Kelscs Kcscared

Posts.Content: Kelscs wrote:         I  think the worst part about doctors apointments is waiting... and waiting... for the apointment... then the results.. then the next apointment... I'v had really sharp breast pain in the same spot 9 months ago, it lasted a few months and went away. I forgot all about it until a few months later that same pain came back in the same spot. It was like i was being stabbed with a knife each time the pain came, which the pain was completely random. Sometimes it last a few days or a week, it just comes and goes for the last four months now. Because of the pain I found a small lump at 4 oclock on my left breast. It is hard round  deep and immovable attatched to other tissue or chest wall. I was nervous becasue breast and ovarian are interlinked and they strongly run in my family.              The Dr. assured me it was likely a cyst, and since I had pain it was a good sign that it wasnt cancer. Also since im onl y 21, its even more unlikely. I scheduled an ultrasound, it showed a solid mass 7 x 6 x 8 mm. The radiologist said it was likely a fibroadenoma, it looked pretty good mostly round smooth with a couple irregularities. He said I should monitor it and come back in 6 months. However, considering my family history ( All diagnosed in 30s and 40s and one at 23 yrs old), my doctor said I should have a biopsy.        Today is my appointment with a surgeon, its just a consult, to talk about my ultrasound, and different biopsys. Im really nervous. I swear Ive read everything online about fibroadenomas, and breast cancer and the differences. My charachteristics are half and half. I know its rare to have pain with breast cancer, but my  grandmother from my mom's side ( not the side of the family with the strong history, she was diagnosed at 63), also is going through breast cancer. A few days ago she told me how hers started, and it was the same as how I described. First pain for months, then  none for months, then pain again and she found a lump. She waited a long time to go to the dr. when she did it was stage 4 breast cancer, its now spread to her bones, and she recently broke her hip.       Im just really scared, not only for me, but for my grandmother. I know im writing a book on here, I just really needed to vent, because I feel like im going a little crazzy in anticipation, and I really don't have anyone to talk to about all this.      Thank You for listening                      Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anxiously waiting Kelscs Kcscared

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2010 06:11PM Kelscs wrote: Thanks Lisa,   I appreciate your post so much. The surgeon did an exam, but he also couldnt find it just as the previous Dr.s couldnt until I put my finger on it. Its because its small and deep. We decided on excisional biopsy. Since at times it can be very painful, also to make sure they have a good sample to check it. My appointment is a week from today, the 15th. I'm really nervous. In one breath, I am like no no way thatd be impossible, and in the next im scared to death because of the family history. I guess only time and waitng will tell.           - Kelsey
